title: The trailer for the remake of horror film IT has been released - and it's absolutely terrifying

The full trailer for the remake of Stephen King's IT has just been released - and it's as scary as you'd expect. 
The two and a half minute clip is unnervingly creepy, and after a gentle start with young Georgie Denborough sailing a paper boat down a kerbside puddle, we're then introduced to something hideous staring from a grating. And it's not pretty. 
In the reboot, Bill Skarsgård takes over the role of creepy clown Pennywise - made famous in the original by Tim Curry, who was the stuff of nightmares for many a child of the 80s. Finn Wolfhard, AKA Mike from Stranger Things also stars. Bill Skarsgard is terrifying as Pennywise the clown (Photo: Warner Bros) People are going missing in the town of Derry, Maine (Photo: Facebook/Warner Bros) That moment you realise your mum is actually a scary clown (Photo: Facebook/Warner Bros) Scariest bath ever (Photo: Facebook/Warner Bros) Pennywise, just looking scary, hiding behind a balloon (Photo: Facebook/Warner Bros) The scariest of scary houses in the town (Photo: Facebook/Warner Bros) That balloon's up to no good, kid (Photo: Facebook/Warner Bros) Read More Trailer for Stephen King's IT remake is already making horror fans scream in fear 
The film follows the story of a group of kids in a Maine town, who are faced with their biggest fears when they meet evil clown Pennywise. 
There's creepy faces in the sewers, scary balloons, gushing blood, creepy hands, projectors with a life of their own and the trailer ends with Pennywise turning out to be Georgie's mum in a photograph, billowing long ginger hair and all. 
Earlier this month, the teaser of the remake scared fans at the South By South West film festival where the clip made its debut, but hadn't been made available to watch before now. 
The film will be the second adaptation of the iconic 1986 horror text. 
Stephen King's IT is set to hit the big screen on 8 September 2017. Like us on Facebook
